snippet: In Neil Simon’s comedy “The Odd Couple,” Felix is as morose and finicky as Oscar is cheerful and easygoing; when he moves in, he turns Oscar’s relaxed home into a bastion of neatness.
abstract: Anita Gates reviews Connecticut Repertory Theater production of Neil Simon play The Odd Couple, directed by Vincent J Cardinal and starring Pat Sajak and Joe Moore (Metropolitan/Connecticut).
lead_paragraph: In Neil Simon’s comedy “The Odd Couple,” Felix is as morose and finicky as Oscar is cheerful and easygoing; when he moves in, he turns Oscar’s relaxed home into a bastion of neatness.

headline.seo: A Review of ‘The Odd Couple,’ in Storrs
headline.main: Fortune’s Wheel Casts Mismatched Friends Together
headline.print_headline: Fortune’s Wheel Casts Mismatched Friends Together
